de.a46.memory.gui
Class MainPanel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--java.awt.Panel
                    |
                    +--de.a46.memory.gui.MainPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, ButtonbarListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, MGUI, MPanelListener, java.io.Serializable, YesNoListener
public class MainPanel
extends java.awt.Panel
implements MPanelListener, MGUI, YesNoListener, ButtonbarListener

Class MainPanel is the main gui class. its father-component is the applet-extending Starter, child components are a ButtonbarPanel, a LeftPanel and a RightPanel. its size is fixed 720 x 502 pixel.

this is also an active component, because it performs reaction to buttonbar clicked events and to ActionEvents from the HelpPanel and the ExitPanel. Only moves (cardClicked, imageClicked) and heavy actions (newgameAction, exitAction) are passed to a registered UserActionListener.

Beside the three listener interfaces also an interface MGUI is implemented. So a MainPanel can perform commands given by an instance of class Game.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Till Zoppke
See Also:

initCurrentData

public void initCurrentData()
reinits this component for a new game. Childs are reseted, too.

mpanelClicked

public void mpanelClicked(MPanel source)
This method is called either when (1) a hiddencard is clicked or when (2) a bigImage is clicked. In case (1) the correct highlightimage will be set to the hiddencard, then UserActionListener.cardClicked(int) will be called. In case (2) UserActionListener.bigImageClicked() is called immediately.
Specified by:
mpanelClicked in interface MPanelListener
Parameters:
e - the MPanelEvent that occures.

isEmptyField

public boolean isEmptyField()
Checks whether there are any hiddencards left on the rightPanel.
Returns:
true if all hiddenCards at the fieldPanel are in HiddencardPanel.OFF_STATE,
false if still some cards are there.

hasEqualImages

public boolean hasEqualImages()
checks, whether the images shown on the LeftPanel are equal. If less than two images are open, false will be returned.
Specified by:
hasEqualImages in interface MGUI
Returns:
true if both images are equal,
false if they are different or less than two are displayed.

setCardEnabled

public void setCardEnabled(int cardID,
                           boolean status)
sets the status of a specified card in the fieldPanel.
Specified by:
setCardEnabled in interface MGUI
Parameters:
cardID - an int determining the hiddencard by its id,
status - if true, the new status is MPanel.ENABLED,
if false, the new status is MPanel.DISABLED.

removeCard

public void removeCard(int cardID)
removes one card from the FieldPanel. That means setting it to HiddencardPanel.OFF_STATE.
Specified by:

Specified by:
setBigImage in interface MGUI
Parameters:
index - an int representing the index of the target Panel as encoded by LeftPanel.UPPER, LeftPanel.LOWER
imageID - an int as the index of this image in the currentCardImages array. value -1 represents, that no image should be displayed.

public void noButtonClicked()
is called, when the user clicks the no button on the ExitPanel. The RightPanel is set to the FieldPanel over here.
Specified by:

yesButtonClicked

public void yesButtonClicked()
is called, when the user clicks the yes button on the ExitPanel. All registered UserActionListeners will be informed by calling UserActionListener.exitAction().
Specified by:
yesButtonClicked in interface YesNoListener

exitButtonClicked

public void exitButtonClicked()
is called, when the user clicks the exit button. The RightPanel will be set to ExitPanel.
